item.text: Employee manual or handbook and code of conduct (if separate) with revision history, including sanction policies and performance evaluation policies
As evidence, you can provide the Employee Handbook.

Job descriptions that define (1) the role and responsibilities and (2) the skills and expertise needed of executive management (e.g. President, CIO, CTO, CEO, CFO, etc.) Please provide evidence of executive management job postings if available as well
As evidence, you can provide the Executive job descriptions details.
As evidence, you can provide the Org Chart details.

Screenshot showing key policies and procedures (e.g. Information Security, Change Management, Incident Management) and the code of conduct/employee handbook were available to employees via company intranet or shared drive
As evidence, you can provide the Policies posted to intranet.
Please provide the URL to the List of new hires.
Provide evidence as a URL along with details of Dropbox, Box, Google Drive, HRMS portal or other storage platforms.
Short listed candidates scheduled for Technical Assessment/ Interview  ( Multiple times based on the need and skill set)
Collecting details for making seat and system arrangements
Planning the Allocation to the Project Team
Latest resume(hard copy) [Update your home address , residence phone and mobile number correctly]
Salary certificate from the last employer
All Educational certificates and final mark list from 10th onwards.
For Address Proof AADHAAR & PAN card
Filling joining form with personnel and official details(Bank,EPF, ESI & Kerala shops account details)
Assigning to the Team and Reporting officer
The main terms and conditions of employment
Introducing to the Colleagues and Team
Assigning to the Team and to the Reporting officer
As evidence, you can provide the List of new hires.
Listing of all personnel hired during the audit period
Signed employee handbook and code of conduct acknowledgements for a sample of new hires
As evidence, you can provide the Signed handbook for new hires (sample).
Please provide the URL to List of employees.
Provide evidence as a URL along with details of Dropbox, Box, Google Drive, HRMS portal or other storage platforms.
As evidence, you can provide the List of employees.
Listing of all current employees, including executive management
For a sample of current employees, evidence that competencies and skills evaluations were performed annually. Evidence could include evaluation forms, tracking tool/spreadsheet, or certificates
As evidence, you can provide the Employee competency review (sample).
Listing of business partners / third parties / vendors / service providers
As evidence, you can provide the Vendor list details.

Evidence that job descriptions of executive management (e.g. President, CIO, CTO, CEO, CFO, etc.) are reviewed annually. Evidence could include a revision date on the job descriptions, emails, signoffs on the job descriptions
As evidence, you can provide the Annual review of Executive job descriptions.
Please provide the URL to Internal Controls Matrix.
Provide evidence as a URL along with details of Dropbox, Box, Google Drive, HRMS portal or other storage platforms.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
An employee handbook and code of conduct are documented and reviewed on an annual basis to outline workforce conduct standards and enforcement procedures.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Personnel are required to acknowledge the employee handbook and code of conduct upon hire and annually thereafter.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Prior to employment, personnel are required to complete a background check.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Performance and conduct evaluations are performed for personnel on an annual basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Employees, third-parties, and customers are directed on how to report unethical behavior in a confidential manner.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Entity policies include probation, suspension, and termination as potential sanctions for employee misconduct.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The entity's third-party agreement requires that third-parties have a code of conduct and employee handbook in place.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

The entity's third-party agreement requires that third-parties  - consider the background, competencies and experience of its personnel; and  - provide regular training to its personnel as it relates to their job role and responsibilities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Operational management assigns responsibility for and monitors the  effectiveness and performance of controls implemented in the environment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A third-party performs an independent assessment of the controls environment annually to assess the effectiveness of controls within the environment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A documented organizational chart is in place to communicate organizational structures, lines of reporting, and areas of authority.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Executive management reviews the organization chart annually and makes updates to the organizational structure and lines of reporting, if necessary.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Reporting relationships and organizational structures are reviewed annually by management.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Roles and responsibilities are defined in written job descriptions and communicated to personnel through the company's [sharepoint site, website, newsletters, email, etc.]
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Roles and responsibilities defined in written job descriptions consider and address specific requirements relevant to [security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy].
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A vendor risk assessment is performed for third-party providers on an annual basis which includes reviewing the activities performed by third-parties.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Executive management considers the roles and responsibilties performed by third parties as well as monitoring the activities performed by third parties in documenting the organizational chart and defining job descriptions.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Policies and procedures are in place that outline the performance evaluation process as well as the competency and training requirements for personnel.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The entity evalutes the competencies and experience of candidates prior to hiring and of personnel transferring job roles or responsibilities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Job requirements are documented in the job descriptions and candidates' abilities to meet these requirements are evaluated as part of the hiring or transfer evaluation process.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Executive management has created a training program for its employees. OR Executive management uses an outside vendor to assist with its continued training of employees.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
As part of the performance evaluation process, the entity rewards its personnel for exceeding expectations as it relates to their job role and responsibilities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Upon hire, personnel are required to acknowledge the employee handbook which requires adherence to the personnel's job role and responsibilities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Organizational and information security policies and procedures are documented for supporting the functioning of controls and processes and made available to its personnel through the company's [sharepoint site, website, newsletters, email, etc.]
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Data flow diagrams, process flowcharts, narratives, and procedures manuals are documented and maintained by the management to identify the relevant internal and external information sources of the system.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

The entity's risk assessment process includes: - identifying the relevant information assets that are critical to business operations; - prioritizing the criticality of those relevant information assets; - identifying and assessing the impact of the threats to those information assets; - identifying and assessing the impact of the vulnerabilities associated with the identified threats; - assessing the likelihood of identified threats and vulnerabilities; - determining the risks associated with the information assets; - addressing the associated risks identified for each identified vulnerability.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Risks identified as a part of the risk assessment process are addressed using one of the following strategies: - avoid the risk; - mitigate the risk; - transfer the risk; or - accept the risk.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
For gaps and vulnerabilities identified from the risk assessment, remediation efforts, including the implementation of controls, are assigned to process owners based on roles and responsibilities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The annual comprehensive risk assessment results are reviewed and approved by appropriate levels of management.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
As part of the annual risk assessment, management reviews the potential threats and vulnerabilities arising from its customers, vendors and third-parties.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

On an annual basis, management identifies and assesses the types of fraud (e.g. fraudulent reporting, loss of assets, unauthorized system access, overriding controls) that could impact their business and operations.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Identified fraud risks are reviewed and addressed using one of the following strategies: - avoid the risk; - mitigate the risk; - transfer the risk; or - accept the risk.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
As part of management's assessment of fraud risks, management considers how personnel could engage in or justify unethical or inappropriate actions.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

As part of management's assessment of fraud risks, management considers threats and vulnerabilities that arise from the use of IT (e.g. unauthorized access, inadequate segregation of duties, default accounts, inadequate password management, unauthorized changes)
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Changes to the business structure and operations are considered and evaluated as part of the annual comprehensive risk assessment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Changes to the regulatory, economic, and physical environment in which the entity operates are considered and evaluated as part of the annual comprehensive risk assessment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Changes to the entity's systems, applications, technologies, and tools are considered and evaluated as part of the annual comprehensive risk assessment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Changes in vendor and third-party relationships are considered and evaluated as part of the annual comprehensive risk assessment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Changes in key management and personnel are considered and evaluated as part of the annual comprehensive risk assessment.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Reporting relationships and organizational structures are reviewed on an annual basis by management.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Monitoring software is used to identify and evaluate ongoing system performance, security threats, changing resource utilization needs, and unusual system activity.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The monitoring software is configured to alert [<Host name> - Critical/Warning - <Description>] when thresholds have been exceeded.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Management reviews policies, procedures and other control documents for accuracy and applicability on an annual basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Vulnerability scans are performed annually on the environment to identify control gaps and vulnerabilitiles.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Business continuity and disaster recovery plans are developed and updated on a annual basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Business continuity and disaster recovery plans are tested on a annual basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Logical and physical access to systems is granted to an employee as a component of the hiring process.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Logical and physical access to systems is revoked as a component of the termination process.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Privileged access to sensitive resources is restricted to defined user roles.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Network administrative access is restricted to user accounts accessible by authorized IT personnel.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Network users are authenticated via individually-assigned user accounts and passwords. Networks are configured to enforce password requirements that include:  Password history  Password age (minimum & maximum)  Password length Complexity
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Network access reviews are completed by management on a Quaterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Operating system administrative access is restricted to user accounts accessible authorized IT personnel.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Operating system users are authenticated via individually-assigned user accounts and passwords. Operating System are configured to enforce password requirements that include:  Password history  Password age (minimum & maximum)  Password length Complexity
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Operating system access reviews are completed by management on a Quaterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Database users are authenticated via individually-assigned user accounts and passwords. Databases are configured to enforce password requirements that include:  Password history  Password age (minimum & maximum)  Password length Complexity
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Database access reviews are completed by management on a Quaterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Application administrative access is restricted to user accounts accessible by authorized IT personnel.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Application users are authenticated via individually-assigned user accounts and passwords. Applications are configured to enforce password requirements that include:  Password history  Password age (minimum & maximum)  Password length Complexity
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Application access reviews are completed by management on a Quaterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The ability to administer VPN access is restricted to user accounts accessible by the following personnel:   Title
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
VPN users are authenticated via multi-factor authentication (username, password, and PIN/OTP/Token) prior to being granted remote access to the system.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
VPN access reviews are completed by management on a Quaterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Network account lockout policies are in place that include:  Account lockout duration  Account lockout threshold  Account lockout counter reset
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Network audit policy configurations are in place that include:  Account logon events  Account management  Directory Service Access  Logon events  Object access  Policy changes  Privilege use  Process tracking  System events

How is the control being performed?
Alerts are generated to notify network administrators of suspicious activity.

How is the control being performed?
Network log reviews are completed by management on a quarterly basis.

Alerts are generated to notify operating system administrators of suspicious activity.

Operating system log reviews are completed by management on a quarterly basis.

Database audit policy configurations are in place that include:  Account logon events  Account management  Directory Service Access  Logon events  Object access  Policy changes  Privilege use  Process tracking  System events

Alerts are generated to notify database administrators of suspicious activity.

Database log reviews are completed by management on a quarterly basis.

Application account lockout policies are in place that include:  Account lockout duration  Account lockout threshold  Account lockout counter reset

Application audit policy configurations are in place that include:  Account logon events  Account management  Directory Service Access  Logon events  Object access  Policy changes  Privilege use  Process tracking  System events
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Alerts are generated to notify application administrators of suspicious activity.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Application log reviews are completed by management on a quarterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Documented incident response policies and procedures are in place to guide personnel in the event of an incident.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Data backup and restore procedures are in place to guide personnel in performing backup activities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
An automated backup system is utilized to perform scheduled system backups.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Full backups of certain application and database components are performed on a Quaterly basis and incremental backups are performed on a Quaterly basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
IT personnel monitor the success or failure of backups, and are notified of backup job status via email notifications.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Documented incident response and escalation procedures for reporting security incidents are in place to guide users in identifying, reporting and mitigating failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The incident response and escalation procedures are reviewed at least annually for effectiveness.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The incident response and escalation procedures define the classification of incidents based on its severity.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A GIT Tracking is utilized to track and respond to incidents.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Resolution of incidents is communicated to users within the corresponding ticket.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Incidents are documented and tracked in a standardized ticketing system and updated to reflect the planned incident and problem resolution.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A security incident analysis is performed for critical incidents to determine the root cause, system impact, and to determine the resolution.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Identified incidents are reviewed, monitored and investigated by an incident response team.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Incidents resulting in the unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information are communicated to the affected users.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Identified incidents are analyzed, classified and prioritized based on system impact to determine the appropriate containment strategy, including a determination of the appropriate response time frame and the determination and execution of the containment approach.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Roles and responsibilities for the design, implementation, maintenance, and execution of the incident response program are defined and documented.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Documented incident response and escalation procedures for reporting security incidents are in place to guide users in identifying, reporting and mitigating failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Incidents are documented and tracked in a standardized ticketing system and updated to reflect the planned incident and problem resolution.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The actions taken to address identified vulnerabilities are documented and communicated to affected parties.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Documented incident response and escalation procedures are in place to guide personnel in addressing the threats posed by security incidents.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Incidents are communicated to those affected through [emails, newsletters, creation of an incident ticket, etc].
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Resolution of incidents are documented within the ticket and communicated to affected users.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Remediation actions taken for security incidents are documented within the ticket and communicated to affected users.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Identified incidents are analyzed, classified and prioritized based on system impact to determine the appropriate containment strategy, including a determination of the appropriate response time frame and the determination and execution of the containment approach.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A security incident analysis is performed for critical incidents to determine the root cause, system impact, and to determine the resolution.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

Identified vulnerabilities are addressed using one of the following strategies: - remediate the identified vulnerability; - avoid the risk posed by the identified vulnerability; - mitigate the risk posed by the identified vulnerability; - transfer the risk posed by the identified vulnerability; or - accept the risk posed by the identified vulnerability.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The incident response and escalation procedures are reviewed at least annually for effectiveness.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Data backup and restore procedures are in place to guide personnel in performing backup activities.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Backup restoration tests are performed on at least an annual basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A security incident analysis is performed for critical incidents to determine the root cause, system impact, and to determine the resolution.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
After critical incidents are investigated and addressed, lessons learned are documented and analyzed. Incident response plans and recovery procedures are updated based on the lessons learned.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
A business continuity and disaster recovery plan is documented to identify and reduce risks, limit the consequences of damaging incidents, and ensure the timely resumption of essential operations.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The disaster recovery plan is tested on an annual basis.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The business continuity and disaster recovery plan and procedures are updated based on disaster recovery plan test results.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Documented change control policies and procedures are in place to guide personnel in the handling system changes.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?

The change management process has defined the following roles and assignments:    Authorization of change requests-owner or business unit manager    Development-application design and support department    Testing-quality assurance department    Implementation software change management group
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
System changes are communicated to both internal and external users.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Access to implement changes in the production environment is restricted to authorized IT personnel.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
System change requests are documented and tracked in a ticketing system.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
System changes are tested prior to implementation.  Types of testing performed depend on the nature of the change.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Back out procedures are documented within each change implementation to allow for rollback of changes when changes impair system operation.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
System changes implemented to the production environment are evaluated for impact to the entity's objectives.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
System changes implemented for remediating incidents follow the standard change management process.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Information security policies and procedures document the baseline requirements for configuration of IT systems and tools.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Documented change control policies and procedures are in place to guide personnel in implementing changes in an emergency situation.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
Management develops third party risk mitigation strategies to address risks identified during the risk assessment process.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The entity has documented procedures for addressing issues identified with third-parties.
When is the control being performed? (Frequency)
How is the control being performed?
The entity has documented procedures for terminating third party relationships.
As evidence, you can provide the Internal Controls Matrix.

Internal Controls Matrix that includes: - a list of the internal controls implemented within the environment and technology infrastructure - who owns and operates each of the internal controls in place - the type of control (manual, automated, preventive, detective, corrective) - frequency control operates (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly, multiple times a day) - documenting the relationship and linkage between business processes, the relevant technologies used to support the business processes, and the controls in place to help secure those business processes

Evidence (e.g. meeting minutes, reports, notes, PowerPoint deck, emails, etc.) that executive management met with operational management annually to assess the effectiveness and performance of internal controls within the environment
As evidence, you can provide the Management internal controls performance meeting details.
Screenshot showing job descriptions were available to employees via company intranet or shared drive
As evidence, you can provide the Job descriptions posted to intranet.
Evidence of the information security and awareness training program created for employees. Evidence could include PowerPoint deck or the actual training program materials/documentation
As evidence, you can provide the Information Security Awareness Training details.

Evidence that employees, third-parties, and customers are directed on how to report unethical behavior in a confidential manner, such as an anonymous hotline phone number or anonymous e-mail address box. (e.g. policies/procedures on reporting unethical behavior, emails on reporting unethical behavior, PowerPoint deck, website)
As evidence, you can provide the Medium to report unethical behavior.

Third party agreement / contract template that third parties/vendors/service providers sign. Ensure agreement / contract includes: -Terms and conditions - Third party commitments, requirements and responsibilities - Entity commitments, requirements and responsibilities - How to report incidents, failures, complaints - Training - Causes for Termination
As evidence, you can provide the Third party contract template.
Contract (third party agreement) for a sample of third-parties/vendors/service providers
As evidence, you can provide the Sample of third party contracts (sample).
Please provide the URL to Sample of third party contracts (sample).
Provide evidence as a URL along with details of Dropbox, Box, Google Drive, HRMS portal or other storage platforms.

extension.valueString: If you don't have Performance Reviews (sample) as evidence, you can refer the our sample version here

item.text: As evidence, you can provide the Performance Reviews (sample).

For a sample of current employees, evidence that a performance and conduct evaluation was performed annually. Evidence could include performance and conduct evaluation forms, a tracking tool/spreadsheet, or certificates
Attestation report (e.g. PCI, SOC, ISO) for third party / vendor / service providers
As evidence, you can provide the Vendor SOC Reports.
A sample of job descriptions including evidence the job descriptions were reviewed annually
As evidence, you can provide the Job description annual review (sample).
Please provide the URL to Vendor risk assessment.
Provide evidence as a URL along with details of Dropbox, Box, Google Drive, HRMS portal or other storage platforms.
A5-5.1.2-Have all information security policies and standards been reviewed in the last 12 months?
A5-5.1.1-Is there a set of information security policies that have been approved by management, published and communicated to constituents?
A5-5.1.2-Describe the cybersecurity deployed with the system, to include infrastructure, application (for example, encryption), and transport.  Security and encryption must be FIPS 140-2 compliant
A5-5.1.2-Are you compliant with relevant cybersecurity standards (e.g., NIST, ISO 27000, NIST CSF,SOC2)
A6-6.1.2-Is there a policy that defines roles, responsibilities and authorities of information security?
A6-6.1.2-Is there segregation of duties for granting access and approving access to Scoped Systems and Data?
A7-7.1.1-Do Human Resource policies include Constituent background screening criteria?
A7-7.2.2-Does the Human Resource policy include a disciplinary process for non-compliance?
A7-7.2.3-Does the Human Resource policy include a disciplinary process for non-compliance?

A8-8.1.3-Is there an acceptable use policy for information and associated assets that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate Constituents and assigned an owner to maintain and periodically review the policy?
A8-8.1.4-Is there a process to verify return of constituent assets (computers, cell phones, access cards, tokens, smart cards, keys, etc.) upon termination?

A8-8.2.1-Is there a policy or procedure for information handling (storing, processing, and communicating) consistent with its classification that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and assigned an owner to maintain and periodically review?
A8-8.2.1-Does the policy or procedure for information handling include storage requirements including authorized use of Public Cloud storage?
A8-8.2.1-Is there a data retention/destruction requirement that includes information on live media, backup/archived media, and information managed by Employees?
A8-8.2.2-Is all Scoped Data sent or received electronically encrypted in transit while outside the network?
A9-9.2.1-Is electronic access to systems containing scoped data removed within 24 hours for terminated constituents?
A9-9.2.1-Is access on applications, operating systems, databases, and network devices provisioned according to the principle of least privilege?
A9-9.2.1-Is there a process to request and receive approval for access to systems transmitting, processing or storing Scoped Systems and Data?
A9-9.4.2-Does system policy require logoff from terminals, PC or servers when the session is finished?
A9-9.2.5-Are user access rights reviewed periodically?
A9-9.2.5-Are access rights reviewed when a constituent changes roles?
A9-9.2.5-Are privileged user access rights reviewed periodically?

A9-9.3.1-Is there a password policy for systems that transmit, process or store Scoped Systems and Data that has been approved by management, communicated to constituents, and enforced on all platforms and network devices? If no, please explain in the 'Additional Information' field.
A9-9.3.1-Does password policy include minimum password length at least eight characters?
A9-9.3.1-Are complex passwords (mix of upper case letters, lower case letters, numbers, and special characters) required on systems transmitting, processing, or storing Scoped Data?
A9-9.3.1-Does password policy prohibit a PIN or secret question as a possible stand-alone method of authentication?
A9-9.3.1/9.4.1-Does password policy require initial and temporary passwords to be random and complex?

A9-9.3.1/9.4.1-Does your solution have features that prevent unauthorized access to the system or system data.  For example, limit user security database access to authorized system administrators only
A9-9.3.1/9.4.1-Are user IDs and passwords communicated/distributed via separate media (e.g., e-mail and phone)?
A9-9.1.1-Are mechanisms established so that access to personal information is limited to authorized personnel based upon their assigned roles and responsibilities?
A9-9.4.5-Is there a control to protect personal information stored on portable media or devices from unauthorized access?
A9-9.4.5-Does your solution provide user name/login and password capabilities for all users, including those members of outside Agencies  for web-based applications/portions of the solution.

A9-9.4.5-Does your solution include role-based functional security, configurable to allow the County to restrict access to some reports, functions, screens, etc.  For example, External Agency; Detention Admin; Detention View Only; System Admin.  Security should be additive for a single user across the entire solution.
A9-9.4.5-Does your solution have a lock-out provision that will lock-out access to an account after an organizationally-defined number (at least three) of unsuccessful logins by the user
A9-9.3.1-Does your solution have features that prevent unauthorized access to the system or system data.  For example, limit user security database access to authorized system administrators only
A10-10.1.1-Does the policy or procedure for information handling include encryption requirements?
A10-10.1.1-Are encryption keys managed and maintained for Scoped Data?
A11-11.1.1-Are there physical security and environmental controls in the data center and office buildings?
A11-11.1.1-Is there a physical security program approved by management, communicated to constituents, and has an owner been assigned to maintain and review?
A11-11.1.1-Do physical access control procedures include collection of access equipment (badges, keys, change pin numbers, etc.) upon termination or status change?
A11-11.1.3-Do physical access control procedures include lost or stolen access card/key reporting required?
A11-11.1.4-Do the physical security and environmental controls include electronic controlled access system (key card, token, fob, biometric reader, etc.)?
A12-12-2.1-Does Scoped Data sent or received electronically include protection against malicious code by network virus inspection or virus scan at the endpoint?
A12-12-2.1-Do scans performed on incoming and outgoing email include phishing prevention?
A12-12-7.1-Are locking screensavers on unattended system displays or locks on consoles required within the data center?
A12-12-7.1Does your solution have features that prevent computer viruses, hidden logic bombs, back doors, or any such code that could be activated inadvertently or otherwise at a later date or time
Is your solution able to automatically generate an application log file for application error messages identifying hardware/software problems, security violations, and attempted breaches
A12-12-1.2-Do changes to the production environment including network, systems, application updates, and code changes subject to the change control process?

A12-12.1.1/12.1.2-Is there an operational change management/Change Control policy or program that has been documented, approved by management, communicated to appropriate Constituents and assigned an owner to maintain and review the policy?
A12-12-1.2-Does the change control process include a formal process to ensure clients are notified prior to changes being made which may impact their service?
A12-12-5.1-Does the change control process include a scheduled maintenance window?
A12-12-1.2-Does the change control process include a scheduled maintenance window which results in client downtime?
A12-12-3.1-Are backups of Scoped Systems and Data performed?
A12-12-3.1-Is there a policy or process for the backup of production data?
A12-12-3.1-Are backup media and restoration procedures tested at least annually?
A12-12-3.1-Are backup and replication errors reviewed and resolved as required?
A12-12-3.1-Are backups containing Scoped Data stored in an environment where the security controls protecting them are equivalent to the production environment?
A12-12-2.1-Is there an anti-malware policy or program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
A12-12-2.1-Does the anti-malware policy or program include defined operating systems that require antivirus?
A12-12-2.1-Does the approved anti-malware policy or program mandate an interval between the availability of a new anti-malware signature update and its deployment no longer than 24 hours?
A12-12-2.1-Is there a vulnerability management policy or program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituent and an owner assigned to maintain and review the policy?

A12-12-4.1-Is sufficient detail contained in Operating System and application logs to support security incident investigations (at a minimum, successful and failed login attempts, and changes to sensitive configuration settings and files)?
A12-12-1.1-Are all systems and applications patched regularly?
A12-12.1.1-Are there any Operating System versions in use within the Scoped Services that no longer have patches released? If yes, please describe in the 'Additional Information' section.
A12-12.1.1-Does the Cloud Hosting Provider provide independent audit reports (e.g., Service Operational Control - SOC) for their cloud hosting services?
A13-13.1.1-Do you have logical or Physical segregation between web, application and database components? i.e., Internet, DMZ, Database?
A13-13.1-2-Is HTTPS enabled for all web pages?
A13-13.1-3-Are non-company managed PCs used to connect to the company network?

A13-13.1-1-Are there security and hardening standards for network devices, including Firewalls, Switches, Routers and Wireless Access Points (baseline configuration, patching, passwords, Access control)?
A13-13.2-1-Is there an approval process prior to installing a network device?
A13-13.1.2-Is every connection to an external network terminated at a firewall?
A13-13.1.2-Do network devices deny all access by default?
A13-13.1.2Do the firewalls have any rules that permit 'any' network, sub network, host, protocol or port on any of the firewalls (internal or external)?
A13-13.1.2Are default passwords changed or disabled prior to placing the device into production?
A13-13.1.2-Is there a remote access policy for systems transmitting, processing and storing Scoped Systems and Data that has been approved by management and communicated to constituents?
A13-13.2.2Are encrypted communications required for all remote connections?
A13-13.3.3-Is remote terminal technology (e.g., RDP, Citrix) used to access Scoped Systems and Data remotely?
A13-13.2.1-Are all available high-risk security patches applied and verified on network devices?
A13-13.1.1-Is there sufficient detail contained in network device logs to support incident investigation?
A13-13.1.1-Are Network Intrusion Detection capabilities employed?
A13-13.1.1-Is there a wireless policy or program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
A13-13.1.1-Does the Wireless Security Policy require wireless connections to be secured with WPA2, and encrypted using AES or CCMP?
A13-13.1.3-Are wireless networking devices connected to networks containing Scoped Systems and Data?
A13-13.1.1-Is there a documented privacy policy or procedures maintained for the protection of information collected, transmitted, processed, or maintained on behalf of the client?
A13-13.1.1-Are privacy risks identified and associated mitigation plans documented in a formal data protection or privacy program plan that is reviewed by management?
A13-13.1.1-Is conspicuous notice provided in clear and plain language about privacy policies and procedures related to client scoped data?
A13-13.2.1-Do privacy notices identify the purposes for which personal information is collected, used, processed, retained, maintained, and disclosed?
A13-13.1.1-Is there an ongoing process to regularly review and update privacy policies and notices on a periodic basis?
A13-13.1.1-Are notices communicated to inform individuals regarding awareness of privacy obligations, retention periods of data collected, and opt-out choices applicable to the services?

A13-13.1.3-Is a website, mobile, or digital service privacy policy developed, maintained, published, and communicated to users on devices or applications that have access to client-scoped privacy data?
A13-13.1.1-Are network Vulnerability Scans performed against internal networks and systems?
A13-13.1.1-Are network vulnerability scans performed against internet-facing networks and systems?
A13-13.1.1-Do network Vulnerability Scans occur at least Monthly?
A13-13.1.1-Are Servers used for transmitting, processing or storing Scoped Data?
A13-13.1.1-Are server security configuration reviews performed regularly to validate compliance with documented standards?
A13-13.1.3-Are server security configuration reviews performed regularly to validate compliance with documented standards?
A13-13.1.3Are all servers configured according to security standards as part of the build process?
A13-13.1.3Are all unnecessary/unused services uninstalled or disabled on all servers?
A13-13.1.3Are vendor default passwords removed, disabled or changed prior to placing any device or system into production?
A14-14.2.1-Do all projects involving Scoped Systems and Data go through some form of information security assessment?
A14-14.2.6-Are Constituents able to view client's unencrypted Data?
A14-14.2.6-Is there a formal Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process?
A14-14.2.4-Is there a documented change management/change control process for applications with Scoped Data?
A14-14.2.8-Are applications evaluated from a security perspective prior to promotion to production?
A14-14.2.1-Is open source software or libraries used to transmit, process or store Scoped Data?
A14-14.2.8/14.2.9-Is a Secure Code Review performed regularly?
A14-14.2.8/14.2.8-Do secure code reviews include regular analysis of vulnerability to recent attacks?
A14-14.2.8/14.2.9-Are identified security vulnerabilities remediated prior to promotion to production?
A14-14.2.8/14.2.9-Is a web site supported, hosted or maintained that has access to Scoped Systems and Data?
A15-15.1.1-Are there any dependencies on critical third party service providers?

A15-15.1.2-Do agreements with third parties who have access to or potential access to client Scoped Data address confidentiality, audit, security, and privacy, including but not limited to incident response, ongoing monitoring limitations on data use, limitations on data sharing, return of data, and secure disposal of privacy data?
16.1.1-Is there a formal Incident Response Plan?
16-1.1-Does the Incident Response Plan include guidance for escalation procedure?
16.1.1-Is there an established incident management program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the program?
16.1.2-Does the Incident Response Plan include actions to be taken in the event of an information security event?
A17-17.1.1-Is there an established business resiliency program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents, and an owner to maintain and review the program?
A17-17.2.1-Does the business resiliency program include a formal annual (or more frequent) executive management review of business continuity key performance indicators, accomplishments, and issues?
A17-17.1.3-Is there a periodic (at least annual) review of your Business Resiliency procedures?
A17-17.1.3-Is communication in the event of a disruption that impacts the delivery of key service provider products and services required?

A18-18.1.4-Are there documented privacy policies and procedures that address choice and consent based on the statutory, regulatory, or contractual obligations to provide privacy protection for client-scoped privacy data?
A18-18.1.4-For client-scoped Data, is personal data collected directly from an individual on behalf of the client or provided to the organization directly by the client?
A18-18.1.4-Is there a documented records retention policy and process with defined schedules that ensure that Personal Information is retained for no longer than necessary?
As evidence, you can provide the Vendor risk assessment.

Most recently completed vendor risk assessment Vendor risk assessment evidence should include: - documenting the operations / responsibilities / activities of the third party/vendor/service provider - documenting the threats and vulnerabilities arising from customers, vendors and third-parties. - identifying and documenting the risks relating to the vulnerabilities - addressing / mitigating the identified risks - assigning responsibility for remediation efforts - management review/sign off on the vendor risk assessment
Please provide the URL to Competency review for new hires (sample).
Provide evidence as a URL along with details of Dropbox, Box, Google Drive, HRMS portal or other storage platforms.
Short listed candidates scheduled for Technical Assessment/ Interview  ( Multiple times based on the need and skill set)
Collecting details for making seat and system arrangements
Planning the Allocation to the Project Team
Latest resume(hard copy) [Update your home address , residence phone and mobile number correctly]
Salary certificate from the last employer
All Educational certificates and final mark list from 10th onwards.
For Address Proof AADHAAR & PAN card
Filling joining form with personnel and official details(Bank,EPF, ESI & Kerala shops account details)
Assigning to the Team and Reporting officer
The main terms and conditions of employment
Introducing to the Colleagues and Team
Assigning to the Team and to the Reporting officer
As evidence, you can provide the Competency review for new hires (sample).

For a sample of new hires, evidence that competencies, skills, and experiences were evaluated prior to hiring, and how candidates are recruited for job openings. Evidence could include the new hire's resume, interview notes/comments, hiring checklist, interview questionnaire, job application, certificates

For a sample of business partners / third parties / vendors, evidence that competencies, skills, and experiences were evaluated prior to working with them. Evidence could include obtaining and reviewing the third party's resume or request for proposal, questionnaire, website, or it could be part of a vendor risk assessment
As evidence, you can provide the Competency review for vendors (sample).
For current employees, evidence of annual training completed relating to job role and responsibilities.
As evidence, you can provide the Current employee training details.
Evidence that employees are cross-trained in roles and responsibilities. Evidence could include training materials; policies and procedures relating to training requirements; PowerPoint deck
As evidence, you can provide the Current employee cross-training details.
Common Criteria Related to Control Environment
